bible.derived: Masoretic Text, Greek New Testament[disambiguation needed]

translations.name: New English Bible
translations.description: The New English Bible (NEB) is a translation of the Bible into modern English directly from the original Greek, Hebrew, and Aramaic texts. The New Testament was published in 1961. The Old Testament (along with the Apocrypha) was published in 1970. In 1989, it was significantly revised and republished as the Revised English Bible. The translators of the New English Bible chose to render their translation using a principle of translation called dynamic equivalence. This method is also referred to as functional equivalence or thought-for-thought translation.
